item.title: Sturgeon's Law: The Year's Top 10%
item.description: The top 10% of games I played this year, since I was hiding all year and 10% of the total was greater than 10.
item.dc:creator: Uni

item.title: Rambling vague complaints at TLOU2
item.description: Unorganized vague critical rambling about TLOU2 that isn't from a fanboy of the first game or someone who hates LGBT people
item.dc:creator: Uni

item.title: Quick review: DJMax Respect V
item.description: Competitive button tapping extreme edition, now on your local personal computing machine.
item.dc:creator: Arc

item.title: Uni's 2019 Wrapup
item.description: Uni spent a way too long writing like 38 pages of short game reviews of the things he played in 2019 so you better read it
item.dc:creator: Uni

item.title: Uni's 2018 Wrapup
item.description: Uni spent a few hours writing over 50 paragraphs of short game reviews of the things he played in 2018 so you better read it
item.dc:creator: Uni

item.title: It's not what it looks like! Some thoughts on Nioh and its context in gaming.
item.description: Nioh was both hyped and maligned for being Team Ninja's attempt at Dark Souls, but there's more to it than meets the eye.
item.dc:creator: Uni

item.title: A Step into the Twilight Zone
item.description: The Twilight Zone is my favorite TV Show of all time, and I wanted to share it with people for a Spooptober special.
item.dc:creator: Uni

item.title: Uni's (first?) Ten Recommendations
item.description: Looking for something to play, or buy on the Steam Sale? Here's ten games I love, in ten different genres, so hopefully there will be something here you're interested in.
item.dc:creator: Uni

item.title: Hitman: The History, The Flaws, The Future
item.description: Square Enix is withdrawing from IO Interactive, the developer of Hitman, and I wanted to talk about why this game's had such a rocky history and what the end of its life cycle might mean.
item.dc:creator: Uni

item.title: ActRaiser 2, an action game design retrospective
item.description: ActRaiser 2, and reflections on enjoyment derived from fast-paced action games. Arc makes an attempt at explaining why he also likes bad games.
item.dc:creator: Arc

item.title: Some thoughts on Myst, Riven, The Witness, and other stuff.
item.description: Scattered thoughts on Myst, Riven, and the Witness, or why I like bad games more than a good one; not really any spoilers, there's some vague references to what happens in game but nothing that will give away a solution or plot.
item.dc:creator: Uni
